definition: the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound

sentences.english: Is he trying to put messy lives into perfect prose?
sentences.chinese: 他是否正在嘗試將混亂的人生提煉成完美的韻文？

sentences.english: His book was in parts written in verse.
sentences.chinese: 他的書有許多地方是用韻文寫的。

sentences.english: Being able to chant fruits and review vocabularies of colors.
sentences.chinese: 會讀誦水果韻文，並複習顏色的單字。

sentences.english: A dance is a measured pace, as a verse is a measured speech.
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈是一串有規則的步法，就如韻文是擬好的言語。

sentences.english: Literature usually takes the form of prose or verse.
sentences.chinese: 文學通常表現爲用散文體或韻文體所寫的文字形式。

sentences.english: And, by the incantation of this verse.
sentences.chinese: 請憑藉我這韻文寫就的符咒。

sentences.english: There were several versions of a verse.

sentences.chinese: 紙張背面的宇宙韻文在宇宙大學很受歡迎。

sentences.english: Not all verse is great poetry.
sentences.chinese: 並非所有的韻文都是偉大的詩篇。

sentences.english: The agreement and disagreement of verse and music with refined and popular tastes is an important factor that has influenced the development of the genre of Chinese verse.
sentences.chinese: 文樂的雅俗離合是影響中國韻文文體演變的重要因素。

sentences.english: Most of the play is written in verse, but some of it is in prose.
sentences.chinese: 這劇本大部份是用韻文寫的，不過有一些是用散文。

definition: study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
